text: (upbeat music)
- So, Chris, you recently attended
one of our AWS CISO circles.

Could you share with what
your experience was there?
- Yeah, really enjoyed it.

And there were a couple things
that really stood out to me.

One is certainly the
opportunity to network

and be around CISOs who are
figuring things out in AWS,
and asking the hard questions.

That was one of my favorite
parts was the AWS folks

coming in and listening,
soliciting feedback,

giving us insight into
things that were coming,

but also the CISOs like
holding nothing back
and being really honest.

And I, hopefully that leads to
great outcomes on both sides

where CISOs and security
leaders understand more

of how to do their job
as it relates to AWS,
and certainly AWS taking that input

and using it to improve
things across the board.

- One of the key aspects
of the CISO circles

is to make sure that Chatham
House rule is in effect.
- [Chris] Yeah.
- And NDAs are in effect.

Did that free you up
to be more vulnerable,
for lack of a better word,
with your peers in the room?
- Yeah, absolutely.

I mean, that's always the way
to do that type of session

is to make sure that people
feel that safety going in,

that what they say isn't
gonna end up in a blog post

or repeated, you know,
as a way for somebody
to get an outcome on their own.
And so critical to any function like that.

And, you know, the great
thing about working with,

in and around CISOs is
they understand that,

and they understand the
consequences of it right?

And so they're very
much compliant with that
on the back end of it.

- And lastly, will you
be going to another one?
- I sure hope so.
Yeah, we had a great time

and a lot of great
connections and information.
(upbeat music)
